Module org.microbean.type
Package org.microbean.type

Interface Owner<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type describing the type representation type
All Known Implementing Classes:
CdiType, JavaType, Type
public interface Owner<T>
An interface whose implementations represent a Java type or a Java executable for equality comparison purposes and no other.
Author:
Laird Nelson

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    default boolean
    hasParameters()
    Returns true if and only if this Owner represents an executable by virtue of having parameters.
    default boolean
    hasTypeParameters()

    name()
    Returns the name of this Owner if it has one or null if it does not.

    named()
    Returns true if and only if this Owner represents either a Java type that has a name, or an executable.
    default Object
    object()
    Returns the object this Owner is modeling, or null if that information is not supplied by the implementation.

    owner()
    Returns the Owner of this Owner, or null if there is no such Owner.

    Returns an unmodifiable List of this Owner's parameters, if this Owner represents an executable, or null if it does not.

    Returns true if this Owner represents the same thing as that represented by the supplied Owner.
    Type<T>

    If this Owner represents a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns a Type representing its raw type or generic component type, or, if this Owner represents an constructor, returns a Type representing void or Void, or, if this Owner represents a method, returns a Type representing its generic return type, or returns this (the Owner in this case will be known to be a Type).

    typeParameters()
    Returns an unmodifiable List of this Owner's type parameters.

      Implementations of this method may, and often will, return null.

      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • named

      @OverridingEncouraged default boolean named()
      Returns true if and only if this Owner represents either a Java type that has a name, or an executable.

      In the Java reflective type system, only Class, TypeVariable, and Executable instances have names.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Owner represents either a Java type that has a name, or an executable
      See Also:
      • name()
      • Class.getName()
      • TypeVariable.getName()
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • name

      String name()
      Returns the name of this Owner if it has one or null if it does not.

      Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type system have names. Owners representing executables do too.

      Returns:
      the name of this Owner, or null
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method may, and often will, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • type

      Type<T> type()
      If this Owner represents a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns a Type representing its raw type or generic component type, or, if this Owner represents an constructor, returns a Type representing void or Void, or, if this Owner represents a method, returns a Type representing its generic return type, or returns this (the Owner in this case will be known to be a Type).

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      a suitable Type; never null; often this
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • hasParameters

      @OverridingEncouraged default boolean hasParameters()
      Returns true if and only if this Owner represents an executable by virtue of having parameters.

      This implementation calls the parameters() method and returns true if the resulting List is not null and is not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Owner represents an executable by virtue of having parameters
      See Also:
      • parameters()

    • parameters

      List<? extends Type<T>> parameters()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this Owner's parameters, if this Owner represents an executable, or null if it does not.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this Owner's parameters, if this Owner represents an executable, or null if it does not
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method may, and often will, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • hasTypeParameters

      @OverridingEncouraged default boolean hasTypeParameters()
      Returns true if and only if this Owner represents a generic class or a generic executable by virtue of having type parameters.

      This implementation calls the typeParameters() method and returns true if the resulting List is not null and not empty. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a faster implementation.

      Returns:
      true if and only if this Owner represents a generic class or a generic executable by virtue of having type parameters
      See Also:
      • typeParameters()
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • typeParameters

      List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this Owner's type parameters.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models a generic class or a generic executable.

      Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not meet these requirements.

      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this Type's type parameters; never null
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method must not return null.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • represents

      @OverridingEncouraged default <X> boolean represents(Owner<X> other)
      Returns true if this Owner represents the same thing as that represented by the supplied Owner.

      Representation is not the same thing as equality. Specifically, an Owner may represent another Owner exactly, but may not be equal to it.

      Equality is subordinate to type representation. That is, in determining whether a given Owner represents another Owner, their equals(Object) methods may be called, but an Owner's equals(Object) method must not call represents(Owner).

      Type Parameters:
      X - the type representation type used by the supplied Owner
      Parameters:
      other - the Owner to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
      Returns:
      true if this Owner represents the same thing as that represented by the supplied Owner
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent and deterministic.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.
